Package core.modAPI

Interface TileDrawer

  • public interface TileDrawer
    Only one implementation of this interface can be loaded at once. Implementations of this interface handle drawing tiles (individually). If your mod has tile attributes that you'd like to represent visually, I recommend writing an implementation of this interface.
    Author:
    clay

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw​(Tile t,
          float scaleUp)
        Draw the given tile at the given scale. Tiles are (unscaled) one unit long. Make sure to draw this tile at the position (t.x * scaleUp, t.y * scaleUp).
        Parameters:
        t - the tile to be drawn
        scaleUp - the scale at which to draw the tile

      • drawBlendLayer

        void drawBlendLayer​(Tile t,
                    float scaleUp)
        This is a fun little optional method. It's purpose is to make adjacent tiles blend together when that option is toggled from the main menu. It's reccomended to simply draw a larger, lower alpha version of what you would draw in the method draw()
        Parameters:
        t -
        scaleUp -

      • drawInformation

        void drawInformation​(Tile t,
                     float scaleUp)
        Draw the mouseover information for the given tile
        Parameters:
        t -
        scaleUp -

      • getColor

        int getColor​(Tile t)
        Get the draw color of the given tile. Used for creatures' senses.
        Parameters:
        t - the tile to get the color of
        Returns:
        the color of the tile t
